result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam T. Hufnagel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 05/22/2015 AMENDMENT TO JOC:  The JOC has been Amended to show the Defendant's correct Date of Birth as:  April 25, 1981.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------------

No contact with victim without the victim and probation agent's consent.
----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
----------------------------------
Restitution was paid up front, in full, from Attorney's Trust Account on May 6, 2015.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before 6-1-2015 at 8:00 a.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam T. Hufnagel

Defendant Adam T. Hufnagel in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
**AMENDMENT 11-05-2014 - No contact with UW-Whitewater Campus without the consent and authorization of Dean or his designee.

Defendant Adam T. Hufnagel in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDMENT 11-05-2014 - No contact with UW-Whitewater Campus without the consent and authorization of Dean or his designee.
 
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH UW-WHITEWATER WITH OUT THEIR CONSENT AND AUTHORIZATION OF DEAN OR HIS DESIGNEE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Adam T. Hufnagel appeared, Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
